Modules¶

obsidian.find_rings¶

Process data and search for rings

obsidian.find_rings.all_at_once(model, data_directory, dump, max_res, find_kwargs)¶

Process all data first and then classify each datablock (grid_scan) in turn.

Parameters:
  • model – trained keras classifier
  • data_directory (str) – top level image directory containing grid scans
  • dump (str) – local storage directory for intermediate files
  • max_res (float) – maximum resultion to which images are cut / to extract data from
obsidian.find_rings.find_rings(model, data_frame, show_top=10, display_top=False, name='')¶

Feed collection of data to a pretrained model, predict probabilities of the presence of protein rings and display most likely candidates

Parameters:
  • data_frame (pd.DataFrame) – database to be analysed, containing ‘Path’ and ‘Data’ columns
  • model – keras pretrained model
  • show_top (int) – n most highly rated images to display
  • display_top (bool) – if True, display highest ranging images graphically
  • name (str) – datablock title
obsidian.find_rings.main(argv)¶

Command line options:

  • -d: data directory containing images to be classified
  • -t: top n images to display / save to summary.txt
  • –display: if specified, display top n images to desktop for each sample
obsidian.find_rings.one_by_one(model, data_directory, dump, max_res, find_kwargs)¶

Process each grid scan and classify in turn, before moving onto next image folder. After each folder, the created data file will be deleted.

Parameters:
  • model – trained keras classifier
  • data_directory (str) – top level image directory containing grid scans
  • dump (str) – local storage directory for intermediate files
  • max_res (float) – maximum resultion to which images are cut / to extract data from
